meanings.definition: Fold or bend (something) back on itself.
meanings.sent1: She carefully pinfolded the letter before putting it in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: He pinfolds the map to fit it in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to pinfold its tail, thinking it was a clever trick.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands moved swiftly, pinfolding the paper into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent5: The origami master's skillful pinfolding created a beautiful swan.

meanings.definition: A fold or bend in something, especially fabric or paper.
meanings.sent1: The pinfolding on the edge of the tablecloth added a decorative touch.
meanings.sent2: She admired the pinfolding on the origami crane.
meanings.sent3: The pinfolding on the napkin made it look like a fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The pinfolding on the dress gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent5: The pinfolding on the paper airplane helped it glide smoothly.
